explanation.rules:
1. Adjectives follow their nouns.
2. A noun (or the adjective if there is one) gets the marker -ˇE, unless it is inalienably possessed
(body part, kinship term); in the latter case it is preceded by the possessor.
3. Alienable possession is expressed by á between the possessor and the possessed.
4. In compound nouns the last syllable has low tone (“`”).
